Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

More Quiet: Metro-North Quiet Car. Program Expands

Starting April 4, two Quiet Cars will be available on every weekday train - peak and off-peak - thanks to the expansion of our popular "Quiet CALMmute" program. - On all weekday inbound trains, the last two cars are designated Quiet Cars. - On all weekday outbound trains, the first two cars are designated Quiet Cars. Look for the Quiet Car signage identifying the cars. See full details at www.bit.ly/1TOhqxp

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

DAYS 10:15 AM to 3 PM, Tue to Fri, Mar 29 - Apr 1 Astoria-bound N trains run express from Queensboro Plaza to Astoria Blvd. All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.

More Quiet: Metro-North Quiet Car. Program Expands

Starting April 4, two Quiet Cars will be available on every weekday train - peak and off-peak - thanks to the expansion of our popular "Quiet CALMmute" program. - On all weekday inbound trains, the last two cars are designated Quiet Cars. - On all weekday outbound trains, the first two cars are designated Quiet Cars. Look for the Quiet Car signage identifying the cars. See full details at www.bit.ly/1TOhqxp

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Our new timetables, which go into effect Sunday, April 3, look to improve performance in peak periods and accommodate track outages for crucial infrastructure work. See full details at http://bit.ly/1R0hQy8 Be sure to check a new timetable for possible changes to your travel. They are available in Grand Central and at outlying stations, via our free TrainTime App for Apple and Android devices, and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Our new timetables, which go into effect Sunday, April 3, look to improve performance in peak periods and accommodate track outages for crucial infrastructure work. See full details at http://bit.ly/1R0hQy8 Be sure to check a new timetable for possible changes to your travel. They are available in Grand Central and at outlying stations, via our free TrainTime App for Apple and Android devices, and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Our new timetables, which go into effect Sunday, April 3, look to improve performance in peak periods and accommodate track outages for crucial infrastructure work. An Explanation For This Morning's Delays

The delays of up to 15 minutes that you may have experienced during your morning commute resulted from a broken rail shortly after 6 AM. The incident occurred in a critical four-track area between the entrance to the Park Avenue Tunnel and Harlem-125th Street Station along which our Hudson, Harlem and New Haven Lines operate. We immediately dispatched emergency crews to make repairs. However, the broken rail left us with only three tracks in this key area on which to operate trains during the entire rush hour. This eventually caused the build-up of train traffic congestion, resulting in delays across all three train lines. Thank you for your patience and cooperation during this incident.

Metro-North St. Patrick's Day Service: Alcohol Banned on Trains, Platforms, Stations

This Saint Patrick's Day, Today, Thursday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers traveling to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade should buy round trip tickets in advance. On the Upper Hudson Line, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. See full details on train service at www.bit.ly/1nwrNHX Have a happy and safe St. Patrick's Day!
LIRR St. Patrick's Day Parade Alcohol Advisory

To maintain orderly and safe travel for customers going to the St. Patrick's Day Parade, no alcoholic beverages (opened or closed) will be permitted on trains, platforms or at stations today, Thursday, thru 5 AM Friday, March 18. All alcoholic beverages will be confiscated by MTA Police.

Metro-North St. Patrick's Day Service: Alcohol Banned on Trains, Platforms, Stations

This Saint Patrick's Day, Thursday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers traveling to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade should buy round trip tickets in advance. On the Upper Hudson Line, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. See full details on train service at www.bit.ly/1nwrNHX Have a happy and safe St. Patrick's Day!

Metro-North St. Patrick's Day Service: Alcohol Banned on Trains, Platforms, Stations

This Saint Patrick's Day, Thursday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers traveling to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade should buy round trip tickets in advance. On the Upper Hudson Line, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. See full details on train service at www.bit.ly/1nwrNHX Have a happy and safe St. Patrick's Day!

Metro-North St. Patrick's Day Service: Alcohol Banned on Trains, Platforms, Stations

This Saint Patrick's Day, Thursday, March 17, Metro-North will not permit alcoholic beverages on trains, platforms or at stations to maintain orderly travel for customers. Any alcoholic beverages found by MTA Police will be confiscated. Customers traveling to the Saint Patrick's Day Parade should buy round trip tickets in advance. On the Upper Hudson Line, conductors will be posted at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon to collect tickets before customers board trains. See full details on train service at www.bit.ly/1nwrNHX Have a happy and safe St. Patrick's Day!

Trackwork this weekend to install concrete ties between Rockville Centre & Valley Stream will affect LIRR train service primarily on Babylon, Montauk & West Hempstead Branches; with minor impacts to the Far Rockaway, Hempstead, Oyster Bay & Port Jefferson Branches as well. Pick up a copy of the special weekend timetable dated March 12-13 for your branch or see http://bit.ly/1UWwTKX.
